max_row.max_cell: Allows auto discovery of this target by variable browsers such as Distributed System Manager released prior to LabVIEW 2012, and allows this target to access network-published variables hosted by LabVIEW 8.6 or earlier.
Remote Panel Server for LabVIEW RT

Allows accessing VIs as remote panels. This version of the Remote Front Panel Server requires LabVIEW Real-Time 2010. This component does not automatically downgrade. Refer to the RT 2010 Known Issues for a workaround.
EPICS Client I/O Server provides files necessary to communicate with EPICS (Experimental Physics and Industry Control System) servers.
This is used by the LabVIEW WebDAV Client palette and includes support for secure connections.

NI-Industrial Communications for EtherCAT provides both the driver to support the real-time EtherCAT network operation and the configuration tools to configure the network and map the EtherCAT process data to the LabVIEW I/O variable.
This is used by the LabVIEW SMTP Client palette and includes support for secure connections.
NI-Watchdog provides a driver for the watchdog timer on the real-time target.

Network Streams for LabVIEW Real-Time provides the ability to communicate through network streams from VIs running on the target. Network streams facilitate lossless communication between the target and another computing device on the network.
The System State Publisher publishes the CPU and memory usage of the real-time target to the NI Distributed System Manager.
Modbus I/O Server adds Modbus support to the Network Variable Engine.
A module for the system web server that enables it to act as a WebDAV server. This allows remote access to the target's file system via a standard, IT friendly, secure protocol.
DataSocket for LabVIEW Real-Time provides the ability to use DataSocket communication from VIs running on the target.
NI 935x Functional Safety Module Support provides the necessary components used by NI CompactRIO clients with functional safety modules.
I/O Variable Remote Configuration Web Service

The I/O Variable Remote Configuration Web Service allows you to configure I/O variables hosted on the RT target from a remote computer. Warning: Installing this component could increase your target's exposure to web-based attacks. Visit ni.com/info and enter the Info Code RTSecurity for details on protecting your system.
Allows LabVIEW VIs to be executed as Web services.

USB Support enables support for accessing USB thumb drives. If the USB controller shares an interrupt line with other devices in the system, installing this component may affect the performance of those devices.
This is used by the LabVIEW HTTP Client palette and includes support for HTTPS connections.
EPICS Server I/O Server provides files necessary to publish shared variables to the EPICS (Experimental Physics and Industry Control System) network.
Files necessary to use LabVIEW Control Design and Simulation Module.
Network Variable Engine allows the LabVIEW Real-Time target to host I/O servers and network-published variables. This component requires that the target have at least 32MB total memory.
Variable Client Support for LabVIEW RT
Variable Client Support for LabVIEW RT allows the LabVIEW Real-Time target to access network-published variables.
This is used by the LabVIEW WebDAV Client palette and does not include support for secure connections.
Enables remote configuration and monitoring of the system from a standard Web browser.
NI System Configuration Remote Support provides web services for network discovery and configuration.
This is used by the LabVIEW SMTP Client palette and does not include support for secure connections.
Allows LabVIEW VIs to be executed as Web Services.
VISA provides an API for instrument control. This component includes the NI-VISA core and the NI-VISA Serial Passport for Serial resources. This includes both RS-232 and RS-485.
NI-RIO IO Scan provides NI Scan Engine support for C Series I/O.
This is used by the LabVIEW HTTP Client palette and does not include support for HTTPS connections.
NI System Configuration API provides libraries and other files necessary to support applications that discover and configure systems and devices.
The Language Support for Japanese enables support for the Japanese language within LabVIEW.
The Language Support for Simplified Chinese enables support for the Simplified Chinese language within LabVIEW.
Allows DLLs built with Visual Studio 2010 to be run on a target.

max_report.max_provider_report:
Software set recommended by National Instruments
Recommended software stack for use with LabVIEW 2019
Software Name Version Description
Variable Legacy Protocol Support 19.0.0 Allows auto discovery of this target by variable browsers such as Distributed System Manager released prior to LabVIEW 2012, and allows this target to access network-published variables hosted by LabVIEW 8.6 or earlier.
Variable Legacy Server Support 19.0.0 Allows variables hosted on this target to be accessed by versions of LabVIEW prior to 2009 and clients running LabVIEW for Mac OS X or Linux
Remote Panel Server for LabVIEW RT 19.0.0 Allows accessing VIs as remote panels. This version of the Remote Front Panel Server requires LabVIEW Real-Time 2010. This component does not automatically downgrade. Refer to the RT 2010 Known Issues for a workaround.
EPICS Client I/O Server 19.0.0 EPICS Client I/O Server provides files necessary to communicate with EPICS (Experimental Physics and Industry Control System) servers.
WebDAV Client with SSL Support 19.0.0 This is used by the LabVIEW WebDAV Client palette and includes support for secure connections.
NI-Industrial Communications for EtherCAT 19.0 NI-Industrial Communications for EtherCAT provides both the driver to support the real-time EtherCAT network operation and the configuration tools to configure the network and map the EtherCAT process data to the LabVIEW I/O variable.
SMTP Client with SSL Support 19.0.0 This is used by the LabVIEW SMTP Client palette and includes support for secure connections.
NI-Watchdog 19.0.0 NI-Watchdog provides a driver for the watchdog timer on the real-time target.
Network Streams 19.0 Network Streams for LabVIEW Real-Time provides the ability to communicate through network streams from VIs running on the target. Network streams facilitate lossless communication between the target and another computing device on the network.
System State Publisher 7.0.0 The System State Publisher publishes the CPU and memory usage of the real-time target to the NI Distributed System Manager.
Modbus I/O Server 19.0.0 Modbus I/O Server adds Modbus support to the Network Variable Engine.
WebDAV Server 19.0.0 A module for the system web server that enables it to act as a WebDAV server. This allows remote access to the target's file system via a standard, IT friendly, secure protocol.
DataSocket for LabVIEW Real-Time 19.0.0 DataSocket for LabVIEW Real-Time provides the ability to use DataSocket communication from VIs running on the target.
NI 935x Functional Safety Module Support 19.0 NI 935x Functional Safety Module Support provides the necessary components used by NI CompactRIO clients with functional safety modules.
I/O Variable Remote Configuration Web Service 19.0 The I/O Variable Remote Configuration Web Service allows you to configure I/O variables hosted on the RT target from a remote computer. Warning: Installing this component could increase your target's exposure to web-based attacks. Visit ni.com/info and enter the Info Code RTSecurity for details on protecting your system.
NI Application Web Server 19.0.0 Allows LabVIEW VIs to be executed as Web services.
USB Support 1.6 USB Support enables support for accessing USB thumb drives. If the USB controller shares an interrupt line with other devices in the system, installing this component may affect the performance of those devices.
HTTP Client with SSL Support 19.0.0 This is used by the LabVIEW HTTP Client palette and includes support for HTTPS connections.
EPICS Server I/O Server 19.0.0 EPICS Server I/O Server provides files necessary to publish shared variables to the EPICS (Experimental Physics and Industry Control System) network.
LabVIEW Control Design and Simulation 19.0 Files necessary to use LabVIEW Control Design and Simulation Module.
NI-Serial RT 19.0.0 NI-Serial support for LabVIEW Real-Time
NI-Serial 9870 and 9871 Scan Engine Support 19.0.0 Use your 9870 and 9871 modules through the VISA serial API.
Network Variable Engine 19.0.0 Network Variable Engine allows the LabVIEW Real-Time target to host I/O servers and network-published variables. This component requires that the target have at least 32MB total memory.
Variable Client Support for LabVIEW RT 19.0.0 Variable Client Support for LabVIEW RT allows the LabVIEW Real-Time target to access network-published variables.
WebDAV Client 19.0.0 This is used by the LabVIEW WebDAV Client palette and does not include support for secure connections.
NI Web-based Configuration and Monitoring 19.0.0 Enables remote configuration and monitoring of the system from a standard Web browser.
Hardware Configuration Web Support 19.0.0 Hardware Configuration Web Support installs the NI Web-based Configuration and Monitoring System Configuration page. Use this page to view and set system and startup settings for your target.
Network Configuration Web Support 19.0.0 Network Configuration Web Support installs the NI Web-based Configuration and Monitoring Network Configuration page. Use this page to view and set the network settings for your target.
Software Management Web Support 19.0.0 Software Management Web Support installs the NI Web-based Configuration and Monitoring Software Management page. Use this page to view information about the software installed on your target.
Time Configuration Web Support 19.0.0 Time Configuration Web Support installs the NI Web-based Configuration and Monitoring Time Configuration page. Use this page to configure the date and time settings for your target.
NI System Configuration Remote Support 19.0.0 NI System Configuration Remote Support provides web services for network discovery and configuration.
SMTP Client 19.0.0 This is used by the LabVIEW SMTP Client palette and does not include support for secure connections.
SSL Support for LabVIEW RT 19.0.0 SSL support.
Run-Time Engine for Web Services 19.0.0 Allows LabVIEW VIs to be executed as Web Services.
NI-VISA 19.0.0 VISA provides an API for instrument control. This component includes the NI-VISA core and the NI-VISA Serial Passport for Serial resources. This includes both RS-232 and RS-485.
NI-VISA GPIB Passport 19.0.0 The NI-VISA GPIB Passport provides support for VISA applications and drivers that use GPIB resources.
NI-VISA ENET-ASRL Passport 19.0.0 The NI-VISA ENET-Serial Passport provides support for VISA applications and drivers that use ENET-Serial resources. This includes both RS-232 and RS-485.
NI-VISA ENET Passport 19.0.0 The NI-VISA Ethernet Passport provides support for VISA applications and drivers that use TCP/IP resources. This includes VXI-11 and HiSLIP devices as well as raw sockets.
NI-VISA USB Passport 19.0.0 The NI-VISA USB Passport provides support for VISA applications and drivers that use USB resources. This includes USB-TMC devices as well as raw data transfer.
NI-VISA Remote Passport 19.0.0 The NI-VISA Remote Passport provides support for VISA applications and drivers that use remote VISA resources connected to another computer on the network.
NI-VISA Server 19.0.0 The NI-VISA Remote Server shares VISA resources over the network. This enables other clients with the NI-VISA Remote Passport installed to access your resources.
NI-RIO IO Scan 19.0 NI-RIO IO Scan provides NI Scan Engine support for C Series I/O.
HTTP Client 19.0.0 This is used by the LabVIEW HTTP Client palette and does not include support for HTTPS connections.
NI-RIO 19.0 The NI-RIO driver enables LabVIEW Real-Time and remote hosts to communicate with an FPGA target.
CompactRIO Support 19.0 CompactRIO Support provides NI-RIO driver support for CompactRIO controllers and chassis.
NI System Configuration 19.0.0 NI System Configuration API provides libraries and other files necessary to support applications that discover and configure systems and devices.
LabVIEW Real-Time 19.0.0 LabVIEW Real-Time provides the core Real-Time Engine. You must have this component installed to be able to use any other software component.
NI RT Extensions for SMP (MultiCore Support) 19.0.0 The NI Real-Time Extensions for Symmetric Multiprocessing (SMP) enable multi-core systems to use all available cores for running applications.
Language Support for Japanese 19.0.0 The Language Support for Japanese enables support for the Japanese language within LabVIEW.
Language Support for Simplified Chinese 19.0.0 The Language Support for Simplified Chinese enables support for the Simplified Chinese language within LabVIEW.
Microsoft Visual Studio 2008 Runtime Support 1.0 Allows DLLs built with Visual Studio 2008 to be run on a target.
Microsoft Visual Studio 2010 Runtime Support 1.1 Allows DLLs built with Visual Studio 2010 to be run on a target.
Language Support for LabVIEW RT 1.0.0.7 This component adds support for non-ASCII languages on the real-time target. This component is required when using localized strings in your real-time application.
Intel 8254x Ethernet Driver 19.0.0 Intel 8254x Gigabit Ethernet Interface Driver
Intel 1000e Ethernet Driver 19.0.0 Intel 1000e Gigabit Ethernet Interface Driver

max_row.max_cell: NI RT Extensions for SMP (MultiCore Support)
The NI Real-Time Extensions for Symmetric Multiprocessing (SMP) enable multi-core systems to use all available cores for running applications.
The Language Support for Japanese enables support for the Japanese language within LabVIEW.
The Language Support for Simplified Chinese enables support for the Simplified Chinese language within LabVIEW.
Allows DLLs built with Visual Studio 2008 to be run on a target.
Allows DLLs built with Visual Studio 2010 to be run on a target.

NI-VISA USB Passport 19.0.0 The NI-VISA USB Passport provides support for VISA applications and drivers that use USB resources. This includes USB-TMC devices as well as raw data transfer.
NI-VISA Remote Passport 19.0.0 The NI-VISA Remote Passport provides support for VISA applications and drivers that use remote VISA resources connected to another computer on the network.
